head.title: Elyse H. Gould, Peter A. Fields

hedline.hl1: Elyse H. Gould, Peter A. Fields

block.p: Elyse Hope Gould, the daughter of Eileen Gould of New York and the late Stephen Gould, was married last evening to Peter Adam Fields, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Fields of New York. Rabbi Burt Aaron Siegel officiated at the Tarrytown (N.Y.) House.

Mrs. Fields, 28, is a special-education teacher at the Young Adult Institute/New York League for Early Learning. She graduated from the University of Hartford and received a master's degree in special education from Fordham University. Her father was the president of Cash Your Check, a check-cashing chain in southern Florida. Her mother is an executive secretary at Lehman Brothers in New York.

Elyse Hope Gould, the daughter of Eileen Gould of New York and the late Stephen Gould, was married last evening to Peter Adam Fields, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Fields of New York. Rabbi Burt Aaron Siegel officiated at the Tarrytown (N.Y.) House.

Mrs. Fields, 28, is a special-education teacher at the Young Adult Institute/New York League for Early Learning. She graduated from the University of Hartford and received a master's degree in special education from Fordham University. Her father was the president of Cash Your Check, a check-cashing chain in southern Florida. Her mother is an executive secretary at Lehman Brothers in New York.

Mr. Fields, 29, is an associate with the New York law firm of Squadron, Ellenoff, Plesent, Sheinfeld & Sorkin in New York. He graduated from the State University at Albany and the Brooklyn Law School. His mother, Harriet Fields, is an artist in New York. His father is the vice president at Ramsay Fabrics, a manufacturer in New York.
